summary: The Capital Gains Inflation Relief Act of 2025 proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow for the indexing of certain assets for inflation when calculating capital gains or losses. This aims to reduce the tax burden on investments, particularly for assets held for more than three years, by adjusting the basis of those assets for inflation. It defines “indexed assets,” outlines rules for determining the “indexed basis,” and addresses exceptions, including for corporations, regulated investment companies, and other pass-through entities. The amendments apply to assets acquired after December 31, 2025.
